Art. 4.155. 
Order of reductions 
Where the value of the gifts exceeds or equals the available portion, all testamentary dispositions in full or bare ownership which must be reduced in kind in accordance with Article 4.150, paragraph 4, lapse.
Where the testamentary dispositions exceed either the available portion or the portion of this portion which would remain after deducting the value of the gifts, the reduction is made proportionally, without any distinction between universal legacies and particular legacies.   
Nevertheless, if the testator has expressly declared that he intends a particular legacy to be paid in preference to others, this preference is respected. This legacy is then reduced only if the reduction of the other legacies is not sufficient to reconstitute the reserve.
Donations are never reduced until the value of all the assets included in the testamentary dispositions has been exhausted. Where such a reduction is required, it is made starting with the last gift, and so on, going from the last to the oldest.
